column4: once I've connected to a samba share through gnome, how can I *sign out*?
I want to stop connecting as current suer
but I set it to "save password forever"
you can right click it in nautilus and disconnect
that just sounds like permissions/share settings
did you set up a chroot?
but it's possible the guy who originally did system might have
what is the problem? that people can read others directories?
no.  I can only read *my* directory for user I'm signed in as
problem is that I see same thing for my personal share as I see for /administrator
it is not wacky if you set it up that way... you have total control
the link you sent doesn't mention anything about seeing other users home directory
you need to read admin guide
